intro: Macaranga novoguineensis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth macaranga, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas make it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
